page.title: 02BRANDON 1985
page.content: The west part of Brandon has grown rapidly since 1950. Once all farmland, now a mixture of council and private estates.Before the colliery closed in 1960, the full name of the village was Brandon Colliery.An old sawmill gave the name to the large Sawmills Council Estate which was built south of the vicarage.The vicarage, no longer used as such but now divided into flats, is surrounded by houses.Many people were re-housed in the Sawmills when the old colliery houses were demolished in the east part of Brandon.The North Eastern Co-operative Society built a large food supermarket, opened by T.V. personality Hughie Green in 1974.There is a newsagents, hairdressers, bakers and clothes shop in the main shopping area.
